description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
name of data subset – experiment 3
year the data point was obtained
month the data point was obtained
day the data point was obtained
name of the participant
age provided by author
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant
species of individuals participating in the study -chimpanzee / orangutans
species subgroup at time of data collection – WKPRC chimpanzee group a or b/ etc
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
condition (type of tube) presented to the participant in a given session – transparent / opaque / front (hole) / back (hole)
whether the participant was tested before in the same task -  yes / no / with_mom (not tested but present during a test)

test phase presented to the participant  - re-test (transparent) / transfer (opaque) / visual_cause  (front / back): three orangutans having solved the task already in Mendes et al. 2007 received the opaque tube first (transfer1) then the transparent one and then the opaque tube again (transfer2)
whether the participant solved the task – 1 = success / 0 = no success/ no entry = not available
time in seconds it took the participant to solve the task
number of spits to solve the task
time in seconds it took the participant to first spit into the tube
mean duration between spits in seconds
author notes
